title: Loudoun Convention & Visitors Association, Recreation, Loudoun County VA, 2006

features.descript: On the scenic Potomac shore, Algonkian is the perfect place for an afternoon of fun in the sun, a family vacation, a meeting, or your wedding. Features include: clubhouse, pro-shop, snack bar, par 72 golf course, driving range, riverfront vacation cottages, miniature golf, boat/rv storage and ramp, picnic shelters, picnic tables, and nature trail. Receptions for up to 160 people are held in the 3,338 sq. ft. meeting/event room. DOWNPOUR, the water playground, provides buckets of summertime fun.
features.admission: Admission Fee: Free; fee for some activities
features.hours: Park open daily dawn to dusk; activity hours vary.

features.descript: Have the NEED FOR SPEED? This is THE PLACE TO RACE! This indoor karting facility is available in a variety of formats including individual, group, and corporate. You can drop in during non-reserved times or reserve the track for a customized event. Racing is ideal for team-building, product launches, and achievement or milestone celebrations. We can accommodate groups ranging in size from 12 to 100 people. Drivers must be at least 18 years old and have a valid driver's license.
features.hours: Check at our website for hours of operation; call for drop-in hours or to schedule an event.

features.descript: The world-famous Appalachian National Scenic Trail follows Loudoun County's western edge. It is a 2,174-mile footpath that travels along the ridgecrests and valleys of the Appalachian Mountains from Maine to Georgia. The Appalachian Trail (A.T.) is used by day, weekend, and other short-term hikers, section-hikers, and thru-hikers. Thru-hikers hike the entire length of the Trail in one season.
features.admission: Admission Fee: Free; brochure available at the Loudoun County Visitors Center at 222 Catoctin Circle, SE, Suite 100, Leesburg
features.hours: Visitors Center open daily 9am-5pm; Trail open seasonally Apr-Oct Mon-Fri 9am-4pm

features.descript: Two NHL size ice rinks, video arcade, restaurant, and pro shop.
features.hours: Public skating hours vary; please call ahead.

features.descript: Audubon Naturalist Society's Rust Sanctuary is a 68-acre preserve just west of Leesburg open for strolling, hiking, picnicking, and wildlife watching. Habitats include forest, meadows, and water. Come enjoy the manor home's formal gardens, sign up for a guided nature exploration or program, and bring a picnic lunch to enjoy at one of our tables. Our naturalists specialize in native flora and fauna, water quality, and more.
features.hours: Grounds open daily, dawn to dusk. Office open Mon-Fri 9am-5pm.

features.descript: Offers fun, inexpensive whitewater trips on the Shenandoah and Potomac Rivers, including tubing, canoeing, whitewater rafting, and duckies, near historic Harpers Ferry, WV at the northern tip of Loudoun County. Enjoy the sand volleyball court and picnic area with charcoal grills and picnic tables. Pick up all of your picnic needs at the country store next door, and shop in our newly remodeled cabana style retail shop.

This park preserves the site of the Battle of Ball's Bluff. This 1861 clash was the largest to take place in the county during the Civil War. It occurred along the banks of the Potomac River, where the Union fell backward into the river in a defeat that merited the first congressional investigation on war. The national cemetery here is one of the smallest in the country, where 54 Union soldiers are buried (only one of whose identity is known). A one mile loop hiking trail offers interpretive signs. No public restrooms.
features.tours: Tours: Guided tours May-mid-Oct Sat-Sun 11am and 2pm.

features.descript: This 700-acre preserve features many wildlife habitats including wetlands, fields, and forests. Walk along the nature trails, take in the natural beauty of this unique protected environment, and learn about its plants, wildlife, habitats, and history.
features.hours: 8am-4pm on the third Sat-Sun of each month

features.descript: Walk the trails, pick flowers, buy fresh produce, and attend a workshop.
features.park: Blue Ridge Center for Environmental Stewardship

features.descript: The Visitor Center Discovery Room introduces this National Register, Civil War, and Virginia Birding & Wildlife Trail listed park. Hike, fish, picnic, and explore nature and history here. Take a self-guided tour of the park's historic district and walk the road that American Indians, and later, George Washington frequented. See the Civil War Signal Station and learn about its role in the war. Tour other historic sites on the property and enjoy hands-on nature experiences during special events throughout the year.
features.tours: Tours: Vary and are scheduled individually
features.hours: Park open daily dawn-dusk, Visitor Center open daily 9am-5pm.

features.descript: Featuring Cybex & Nautilus, rock climbing wall, competition pool, leisure pool, giant water slide, hot tub spa, indoor jogging track, gymnasium, aerobics studio, childcare, meeting rooms, and birthday packages!
features.park: Claude Moore Recreation Center at Claude Moore Park

features.descript: Premium golf range; lighted, heated, and covered tees; and professional golf instruction. Batting cages (fast and slow pitch), 18-hole miniature golf course, beach volleyball, basketball, and horseshoes. Birthday parties; team, group, and corporate outings; covered pavilions; and catering available.

Olwen Woodier, the author of several cookbooks, offers cooking classes on most Wednesdays and Saturdays in her large modernized farm kitchen. Starting at 10:30 AM, the two-hour classes are followed by a four-course lunch. Classes are offered to small groups and for special events including birthdays, wedding showers, friends' night outs, team building activities, etc. for up to 20 people. Pre-booking is preferred; walk-ins are welcome if space permits - please call ahead.

Awesome fun for corporate outings/team building, birthday parties, bachelor parties, tournaments, or for walk-on recreational players! Ten paintball courses on a wide range of terrains. Scenarios include a fort castle, bunkers, bridges, tree houses, and more. "Walk-on" play is available on weekends and does not require a reservation. Call or check the website for the schedule. Paintball Safety Council certified. American Paintball League rules.
features.admission: Admission Fee: Fee varies; check website.
features.hours: Walk-on play Sat-Sun 10am-5pm, weekdays by reservation.

features.descript: Ida Lee is a 71,000 square foot recreation, fitness, and aquatic facility featuring a 25 meter indoor pool, warm water pool, spa, full size gymnasium, a 6,600 square foot fitness facility, meeting rooms, two racquetball courts, child care, and social hall. It is surrounded by a 138-acre park with soccer/lacrosse fields, 7 court tennis center, playground, picnic shelter, bandstand, and trails.
Family entertainment, laser tag, cosmic golf, arcade, refreshments, and party rooms.
A family-oriented roller skating rink perfect for parties, group events, and great family fun.
Hike an authentic nature trail over hills and through woods with panoramic views of the Potomac River and distant foothills, festooned with seasonal wildflowers. No Restrooms.
features.park: Red Rock Wilderness Overlook Regional Park

features.descript: Looking for an adventure? Go vertical at Sportrock Climbing Centers. We welcome walk-ups and will teach you all of the basics if you have never climbed before. For kids, we offer Kids’ Nite on Fridays and open belay on weekends, where our trained staff will belay your child as he or she scales the wall. Have a group? Come in for a group basic skills class or corporate event. We even have a portable wall we can bring to you!

This 45-mile long paved multi-use recreational trail runs from Shirlington to Purcellville and was built on the former railroad bed of the W&OD Railroad. The park includes an adjacent path for horseback riding, which runs 33 miles from Vienna to Purcellville.
features.park: Washington & Old Dominion Railroad Regional Park

name: Loudoun Convention & Visitors Association, Recreation, Loudoun County VA, 2006
description: This dataset provides a listing of recreational activities in and around Loudoun County VA. Points provide information such as a website and descriptions. All descriptions and other information are from the Visit Loudoun Website.
